messages.subject: Re: Valadictorian speaks out against school
messages.msgSnippet: It was an impressive speech but it came from a public schooled kid.  She wasn t an example of anything being suppressed.  She spent nearly 10 minutes bashing
messages.messageBody:
It was an impressive speech but it came from a public schooled kid. She wasn't an example of anything being suppressed. She spent nearly 10 minutes bashing the system she gamed and from the looks of it, everyone sat there and smiled politely. She credited her "new" perspective on a teacher. Then she finished by talking about how to make the system better. If anything I thought it showed how kids can turn out just fine in public school.

That being said, it also illustrated how a person feels when they realize they've wasted so many years of his/her life in a broken system. I suspect the message was probably lost on pretty much everyone there.
~Michelle

--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, "tinap" <luvvs2learn@...> wrote:
>
> Hello all,
> This is an amazing speech! This is why we unschool! So our kids can express their
> creativity and not be surpressed by the public schools! I'm surprised they didn't silence her microphone. Good for her speaking her mind!
>
> http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9M4tdMsg3ts&feature=youtube_gdata
>
> Tina
>

messages.messageBody:
Hello all,
This is an amazing speech! This is why we unschool! So our kids can express their
creativity and not be surpressed by the public schools! I'm surprised they didn't silence her microphone. Good for her speaking her mind!

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9M4tdMsg3ts&feature=youtube_gdata

Tina
